7// FramebufferAttachment.h: Defines the wrapper class gl::FramebufferAttachment, as well as the
8// objects and related functionality. [OpenGL ES 2.0.24] section 4.4.3 page 108.
9
10#ifndef LIBANGLE_FRAMEBUFFERATTACHMENT_H_
11#define LIBANGLE_FRAMEBUFFERATTACHMENT_H_
12
13#include "angle_gl.h"
14#include "common/angleutils.h"
15#include "libANGLE/Error.h"
16#include "libANGLE/ImageIndex.h"
17#include "libANGLE/Observer.h"
18#include "libANGLE/angletypes.h"
19#include "libANGLE/formatutils.h"
20#include "libANGLE/renderer/FramebufferAttachmentObjectImpl.h"
21
22namespace egl
23{
24class Surface;
25}
26
27namespace rx
28{
29// An implementation-specific object associated with an attachment.
30
31class FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget : angle::NonCopyable
32{
33 public:
34 FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget() {}
35 virtual ~FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget() {}
36};
37
38class FramebufferAttachmentObjectImpl;
39} // namespace rx
40
41namespace gl
42{
43class FramebufferAttachmentObject;
44class Renderbuffer;
45class Texture;
46
47// FramebufferAttachment implements a GL framebuffer attachment.
48// Attachments are "light" containers, which store pointers to ref-counted GL objects.
49// We support GL texture (2D/3D/Cube/2D array) and renderbuffer object attachments.
50// Note: Our old naming scheme used the term "Renderbuffer" for both GL renderbuffers and for
51// framebuffer attachments, which confused their usage.
52
53class FramebufferAttachment final
54{
55 public:
56 FramebufferAttachment();
57
58 FramebufferAttachment(const Context *context,
59 GLenum type,
60 GLenum binding,
61 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
62 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
63 rx::Serial framebufferSerial);
64
65 FramebufferAttachment(FramebufferAttachment &&other);
66 FramebufferAttachment &operator=(FramebufferAttachment &&other);
67
68 ~FramebufferAttachment();
69
70 void detach(const Context *context, rx::Serial framebufferSerial);
71 void attach(const Context *context,
72 GLenum type,
73 GLenum binding,
74 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
75 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
76 GLsizei numViews,
77 GLuint baseViewIndex,
78 bool isMultiview,
79 GLsizei samples,
80 rx::Serial framebufferSerial);
81
82 // Helper methods
83 GLuint getRedSize() const;
84 GLuint getGreenSize() const;
85 GLuint getBlueSize() const;
86 GLuint getAlphaSize() const;
87 GLuint getDepthSize() const;
88 GLuint getStencilSize() const;
89 GLenum getComponentType() const;
90 GLenum getColorEncoding() const;
91
92 bool isTextureWithId(TextureID textureId) const
93 {
94 return mType == GL_TEXTURE && id() == textureId.value;
95 }
96 bool isRenderbufferWithId(GLuint renderbufferId) const
97 {
98 return mType == GL_RENDERBUFFER && id() == renderbufferId;
99 }
100
101 GLenum getBinding() const { return mTarget.binding(); }
102 GLuint id() const;
103
104 // These methods are only legal to call on Texture attachments
105 const ImageIndex &getTextureImageIndex() const;
106 TextureTarget cubeMapFace() const;
107 GLint mipLevel() const;
108 GLint layer() const;
109 bool isLayered() const;
110
111 GLsizei getNumViews() const { return mNumViews; }
112
113 bool isMultiview() const;
114 GLint getBaseViewIndex() const;
115
116 GLsizei getRenderToTextureSamples() const { return mRenderToTextureSamples; }
117
118 // The size of the underlying resource the attachment points to. The 'depth' value will
119 // correspond to a 3D texture depth or the layer count of a 2D array texture. For Surfaces and
120 // Renderbuffers, it will always be 1.
121 Extents getSize() const;
122 Format getFormat() const;
123 GLsizei getSamples() const;
124 // This will always return the actual sample count of the attachment even if
125 // render_to_texture extension is active on this FBattachment object.
126 GLsizei getResourceSamples() const;
127 GLenum type() const { return mType; }
128 bool isAttached() const { return mType != GL_NONE; }
129 bool isRenderable(const Context *context) const;
130
131 Renderbuffer *getRenderbuffer() const;
132 Texture *getTexture() const;
133 const egl::Surface *getSurface() const;
134 FramebufferAttachmentObject *getResource() const;
135 InitState initState() const;
136 angle::Result initializeContents(const Context *context);
137 void setInitState(InitState initState) const;
138
139 // "T" must be static_castable from FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget
140 template <typename T>
141 angle::Result getRenderTarget(const Context *context, GLsizei samples, T **rtOut) const
142 {
143 static_assert(std::is_base_of<rx::FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget, T>(),
144 "Invalid RenderTarget class.");
145 return getRenderTargetImpl(
146 context, samples, reinterpret_cast<rx::FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget **>(rtOut));
147 }
148
149 bool operator==(const FramebufferAttachment &other) const;
150 bool operator!=(const FramebufferAttachment &other) const;
151
152 static const GLsizei kDefaultNumViews;
153 static const GLint kDefaultBaseViewIndex;
154 static const GLint kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples;
155
156 private:
157 angle::Result getRenderTargetImpl(const Context *context,
158 GLsizei samples,
159 rx::FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget **rtOut) const;
160
161 // A framebuffer attachment points to one of three types of resources: Renderbuffers,
162 // Textures and egl::Surface. The "Target" struct indicates which part of the
163 // object an attachment references. For the three types:
164 // - a Renderbuffer has a unique renderable target, and needs no target index
165 // - a Texture has targets for every image and uses an ImageIndex
166 // - a Surface has targets for Color and Depth/Stencil, and uses the attachment binding
167 class Target
168 {
169 public:
170 Target();
171 Target(GLenum binding, const ImageIndex &imageIndex);
172 Target(const Target &other);
173 Target &operator=(const Target &other);
174
175 GLenum binding() const { return mBinding; }
176 const ImageIndex &textureIndex() const { return mTextureIndex; }
177
178 private:
179 GLenum mBinding;
180 ImageIndex mTextureIndex;
181 };
182
183 GLenum mType;
184 Target mTarget;
185 FramebufferAttachmentObject *mResource;
186 GLsizei mNumViews;
187 bool mIsMultiview;
188 GLint mBaseViewIndex;
189 GLsizei mRenderToTextureSamples;
190};
191
192// A base class for objects that FBO Attachments may point to.
193class FramebufferAttachmentObject : public angle::Subject, public angle::ObserverInterface
194{
195 public:
196 FramebufferAttachmentObject();
197 ~FramebufferAttachmentObject() override;
198
199 virtual Extents getAttachmentSize(const ImageIndex &imageIndex) const = 0;
200 virtual Format getAttachmentFormat(GLenum binding, const ImageIndex &imageIndex) const = 0;
201 virtual GLsizei getAttachmentSamples(const ImageIndex &imageIndex) const = 0;
202 virtual bool isRenderable(const Context *context,
203 GLenum binding,
204 const ImageIndex &imageIndex) const = 0;
205
206 virtual void onAttach(const Context *context, rx::Serial framebufferSerial) = 0;
207 virtual void onDetach(const Context *context, rx::Serial framebufferSerial) = 0;
208 virtual GLuint getId() const = 0;
209
210 // These are used for robust resource initialization.
211 virtual InitState initState(const ImageIndex &imageIndex) const = 0;
212 virtual void setInitState(const ImageIndex &imageIndex, InitState initState) = 0;
213
214 angle::Result getAttachmentRenderTarget(const Context *context,
215 GLenum binding,
216 const ImageIndex &imageIndex,
217 GLsizei samples,
218 rx::FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget **rtOut) const;
219
220 angle::Result initializeContents(const Context *context, const ImageIndex &imageIndex);
221
222 protected:
223 virtual rx::FramebufferAttachmentObjectImpl *getAttachmentImpl() const = 0;
224};
225
226inline const ImageIndex &FramebufferAttachment::getTextureImageIndex() const
227{
228 ASSERT(type() == GL_TEXTURE);
229 return mTarget.textureIndex();
230}
231
232inline Extents FramebufferAttachment::getSize() const
233{
234 ASSERT(mResource);
235 return mResource->getAttachmentSize(mTarget.textureIndex());
236}
237
238inline Format FramebufferAttachment::getFormat() const
239{
240 ASSERT(mResource);
241 return mResource->getAttachmentFormat(mTarget.binding(), mTarget.textureIndex());
242}
243
244inline GLsizei FramebufferAttachment::getSamples() const
245{
246 return (mRenderToTextureSamples != kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples) ? getRenderToTextureSamples()
247 : getResourceSamples();
248}
249
250inline GLsizei FramebufferAttachment::getResourceSamples() const
251{
252 ASSERT(mResource);
253 return mResource->getAttachmentSamples(mTarget.textureIndex());
254}
255
256inline angle::Result FramebufferAttachment::getRenderTargetImpl(
257 const Context *context,
258 GLsizei samples,
259 rx::FramebufferAttachmentRenderTarget **rtOut) const
260{
261 ASSERT(mResource);
262 return mResource->getAttachmentRenderTarget(context, mTarget.binding(), mTarget.textureIndex(),
263 samples, rtOut);
264}
265
266inline bool FramebufferAttachment::isRenderable(const Context *context) const
267{
268 ASSERT(mResource);
269 return mResource->isRenderable(context, mTarget.binding(), mTarget.textureIndex());
270}
271
272} // namespace gl
273
274#endif // LIBANGLE_FRAMEBUFFERATTACHMENT_H_
